intro: Bossiaea zarae, commonly known as the Zarae Bossiaea, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense, spherical inflorescences. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It has hairy leaves that help reduce water loss, and its flowering period usually occurs in spring. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
